member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateTrxnOptions.TRANSACTION_DO_NOT_PROMOTE
member.summary: The transaction cannot be distributed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess
member.summary: KTM defines the following enlistment access masks to be used when opening enlistments.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_QUERY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The caller can query KTM for information about the enlistment.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_SET_INFORMATION
member.summary: The caller can set information about the enlistment.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_RECOVER
member.summary: The caller can recover an enlistment.

summary.para: The caller can complete actions that a resource manager does on behalf of the transaction. The following is a list of actions:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_SUPERIOR_RIGHTS
member.summary: The caller can enlist in the transaction as a superior transaction manager.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_GENERIC_READ
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_READ and ENLISTMENT_QUERY_INFORMATION.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_GENERIC_WRITE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE, ENLISTMENT_SET_INFORMATION, and ENLISTMENT_RECOVER.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_GENERIC_EXECUTE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_EXECUTE, ENLISTMENT_RECOVER, and ENLISTMENT_SUBORDINATE_RIGHTS.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.EnlistmentAccess.ENLISTMENT_ALL_ACCESS
member.summary: This value sets all valid bits for an enlistment access value.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK
member.summary: Lists the different types of notifications that can be received by an enlistment.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_MASK
member.summary: A mask that indicates all valid bits for a transaction notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPREPARE
member.summary: This notification is called after a client calls CommitTransaction and either no resource manager (RM) supports single-phase commit or a superior transaction manager (TM) calls PrePrepareEnlistment. This notification is received by the RMs indicating that they should complete any work that could cause other RMs to need to enlist in a transaction, such as flushing its cache. After completing these operations the RM must call PrePrepareComplete. To receive this notification the RM must also support TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPARE and TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPARE
member.summary: This notification is called after the TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPREPARE processing is complete. It signals the RM to complete all the work that is associated with this enlistment so that it can guarantee that a commit operation could succeed and an abort operation could also succeed. Typically, the bulk of the work for a transaction is done during the prepare phase. For durable RMs, they must log their state prior to calling the PrepareComplete function. This is the last chance for the RM to request that the transaction be rolled back.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT
member.summary: This notification signals the RM to complete all the work that is associated with this enlistment. Typically, the RM releases any locks, releases any information necessary to roll back the transaction. The RM must respond by calling the CommitComplete function when it has finished these operations.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_ROLLBACK
member.summary: This notification signals the RM to undo all the work it has done that is associated with the transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPREPARE_COMPLETE
member.summary: This notification signals to the superior TM that a pre-prepare operation was completed successfully.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPARE_COMPLETE
member.summary: This notification signals to the superior TM that a prepare operation was completed successfully.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT_COMPLETE
member.summary: This notification signals to the superior TM that a commit operation was completed successfully.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE
member.summary: This notification signals to the superior TM that a rollback operation was completed successfully.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_RECOVER
member.summary: This notification signals to RMs that they should recover their state because a transaction outcome must be redelivered. For example, when an RM is recovered, and when there are transactions left in-doubt. This notification is delivered once the in-doubt state is resolved.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_SINGLE_PHASE_COMMIT
member.summary: This notification signals the RM to complete and commit the transaction without using a two-phase commit protocol. If the RM wants to use a two-phase operation, it must respond by calling the SinglePhaseReject function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_DELEGATE_COMMIT
member.summary: KTM is signaling to the superior TM to perform a commit operation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_RECOVER_QUERY
member.summary: KTM is signaling to the superior TM to query the status of an in-doubt transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_ENLIST_PREPREPARE
member.summary: This notification signals to the superior TM that pre-prepare notifications must be delivered on the specified enlistment.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_LAST_RECOVER
member.summary: This notification indicates that the recovery operation is complete for this RM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_INDOUBT
member.summary: The specified transaction is in an in-doubt state. The RM receives this notification during recovery operations when a transaction has been prepared, but there is no superior transaction manager (TM) available. For example, when a transaction involves a remote TM and that node is unavailable, its node is unavailable, or the local Distributed Transaction Coordinator service is unavailable, the transaction state is in-doubt.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_TM_ONLINE
member.summary: The TM is online and accepting requests.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_REQUEST_OUTCOME
member.summary: Signals to RMs that there is outcome information available, and that a request for that information should be made.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK.TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT_FINALIZE
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess
member.summary: KTM defines the following enlistment access masks to be used when opening a resource manager.

member.summary: The caller can query for the resource manager (RM) information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_SET_INFORMATION
member.summary: The caller can set the RM information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_RECOVER
member.summary: The caller can recover the specified RM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_ENLIST
member.summary: The caller can enlist an RM in a transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_GET_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: The caller can receive a notification for an RM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_GENERIC_READ
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_READ, RESOURCEMANAGER_QUERY_INFORMATION, and RESOURCEMANAGER_RECOVER.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_GENERIC_WRITE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE, RESOURCEMANAGER_SET_INFORMATION, RESOURCEMANAGER_ENLIST, and RESOURCEMANAGER_GET_NOTIFICATION.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_GENERIC_EXECUTE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_EXECUTE, RESOURCEMANAGER_ENLIST, and RESOURCEMANAGER_GET_NOTIFICATION.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess.RESOURCEMANAGER_ALL_ACCESS
member.summary: The caller has the following privilege: STANDARD_RIGHTS_REQUIRED.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME
member.summary: Defines the outcomes (results) that KTM can assign to a transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeUndetermined
member.summary: The transaction has not yet been committed or rolled back.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeCommitted
member.summary: The transaction has been committed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeAborted
member.summary: The transaction has been rolled back.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess
member.summary: KTM defines the following transaction access masks to be used when opening a transaction.
member.remarks: It is recommended that resource managers, when enlisting in a transaction, specify TRANSACTION_RESOURCE_MANAGER_RIGHTS when opening a transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_QUERY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The caller can query transaction information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_SET_INFORMATION
member.summary: The caller can set transaction information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_ENLIST
member.summary: The caller can enlist in this transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_COMMIT
member.summary: The caller can commit this transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK
member.summary: The caller can roll back this transaction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_PROPAGATE
member.summary: The caller can propagate this transaction to a superior resource manager, such as the Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_GENERIC_READ
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_READ, TRANSACTION_QUERY_INFORMATION, and SYNCHRONIZE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_GENERIC_WRITE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE, TRANSACTION_SET_INFORMATION, TRANSACTION_COMMIT, TRANSACTION_ENLIST, TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK, TRANSACTION_PROPAGATE, and SYNCHRONIZE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_GENERIC_EXECUTE
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: STANDARD_RIGHTS_EXECUTE, TRANSACTION_COMMIT, TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK, and SYNCHRONIZE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_ALL_ACCESS
member.summary: The caller has the following privilege: STANDARD_RIGHTS_REQUIRED, TRANSACTION_GENERIC_READ, TRANSACTION_GENERIC_WRITE, and TRANSACTION_GENERIC_EXECUTE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess.TRANSACTION_RESOURCE_MANAGER_RIGHTS
member.summary: The caller has the following privileges: TRANSACTION_GENERIC_READ, STANDARD_RIGHTS_WRITE, TRANSACTION_SET_INFORMATION, TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK, TRANSACTION_ENLIST, TRANSACTION_PROPAGATE, and SYNCHRONIZE.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitComplete(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Indicates that a resource manager (RM) has finished committing a transaction that was requested by the transaction manager (TM).
member.param: A handle to the enlistment for which the commit operation is completed.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received for this transaction. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitComplete(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Indicates that a resource manager (RM) has finished committing a transaction that was requested by the transaction manager (TM).
member.param: A handle to the enlistment for which the commit operation is completed.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received for this transaction. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Commits the transaction associated with this enlistment handle. This function is used by communication resource managers (sometimes called superior transaction managers).
member.param: A handle to the enlistment to commit.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: A pointer to the latest virtual clock value received for this enlistment. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned by a subordinate TM.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Commits the transaction associated with this enlistment handle. This function is used by communication resource managers (sometimes called superior transaction managers).
member.param: A handle to the enlistment to commit.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: A pointer to the latest virtual clock value received for this enlistment. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned by a subordinate TM.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitTransaction(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN)
member.summary: Requests that the specified transaction be committed.

param.name: TransactionHandle
param.para: A handle to the transaction to be committed.
This handle must have been opened with the TRANSACTION_COMMIT access right. For more information, see KTM Security and Access Rights.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: You can commit any transaction handle that has been opened or created using the TRANSACTION_COMMIT permission; any application can commit a transaction, not just the creator.
This function can only be called if the transaction is still active, not prepared, pre-prepared, or rolled back.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CommitTransactionAsync(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN)
member.summary: Requests that the specified transaction be committed.

param.name: TransactionHandle
param.para: A handle to the transaction to be committed.
This handle must have been opened with the TRANSACTION_COMMIT access right. For more information, see KTM Security and Access Rights.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. Success means that the function completed synchronously, and the calling application does not need to wait for pending results.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HRESMGR,Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.NOTIFICATION_MASK,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateEnlistmentOptions,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates an enlistment, sets its initial state, and opens a handle to the enlistment with the specified access.
member.param: A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that contains the security attributes for the enlistment manager. Specify NULL to obtain the default attributes.
A handle to the resource manager (RM) to enlist.
A handle to the transaction in which the RM is enlisting.
The notifications this RM is requesting for the TransactionHandle parameter. For a list of valid values, see NOTIFICATION_MASK.

param.name: CreateOptions
param.para: Any optional enlistment instructions.

item.term: Enlist as a superior transaction manager.

member.param: A pointer to a user-defined structure used by the RM that is returned when a notification is sent in the TRANSACTION_NOTIFICATION structure. This is typically used to associate a private structure with this specific transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the enlistment.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: Windows Vista: Any attempt to enlist during the pre-prepare phase or later will fail.
If you do not specify within your notification mask that you accept a single-phase commit request, KTM always performs a two-phase commit operation.
Keep the following notification rules in mind when enlisting in transactions:

item.term: The RM must always request rollback notification.
If the RM requests prepare notification, it must also request commit notification.
If the RM requests a single-phase commit operation, it must also specify prepare and commit notifications.
The only time an RM is not required to request commit notifications is when it is requesting at least a pair of pre-prepare and rollback notifications.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateResourceManager(Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES,System.Guid@,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateRMOptions,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HTRXNMGR,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new resource manager (RM) object, and associates the RM with a transaction manager (TM).
member.param: A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that contains the security attributes for the resource manager. Specify NULL to obtain the default attributes.
A pointer the resource manager GUID. This parameter is required and must not be NULL.

param.name: CreateOptions
param.para: Any optional attributes for the new RM.

item.term: Indicates that the RM is volatile, and does not perform recovery.

member.param: A handle to the TM that will manage the transactions for this RM.
A description for this RM.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the RM.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: Immediately after calling this function, you must call RecoverResourceManager.
An RM is an endpoint for TM notifications regarding transactions that the RM has enlisted in.

RMs are typically persistent, meaning that after a system failure, they must be reopened to perform certain operations. Volatile, or transient, RMs can be created by calling the CreateResourceManager function and by specifying RESOURCE_MANAGER_VOLATILE. Volatile RMs do not perform recovery operations, but do require notifications about a transaction.
You can create a volatile RM on a durable TM, but you cannot create a durable RM on a volatile TM.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateTransaction(Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES,System.IntPtr,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateTrxnOptions,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new transaction object.

param.name: lpTransactionAttributes
param.para: A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes. If this parameter is NULL, the handle cannot be inherited.

The lpSecurityDescriptor member of the structure specifies a security descriptor for the new event. If lpTransactionAttributes is NULL, the object gets a default security descriptor. The access control lists (ACL) in the default security descriptor for a transaction come from the primary or impersonation token of the creator.

member.param: Reserved. Must be zero (0).

param.name: CreateOptions
param.para: Any optional transaction instructions.

member.param: Reserved; specify zero (0).
Reserved; specify zero (0).

param.name: Timeout
param.para: The time-out interval, in milliseconds. If a nonzero value is specified, the transaction will be aborted when the interval elapses if it has not already reached the prepared state.
Specify zero (0) or INFINITE to provide an infinite time-out.

member.param: A user-readable description of the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the transaction.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: Use the CloseHandle function to close the transaction handle. If the last transaction handle is closed before a client calls the CommitTransaction function with the transaction handle, then KTM rolls back the transaction.

If the transaction might need to be promotable to a distributed transaction, then you must grant the Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) access rights to enlist in the transaction. To do this, the lpTransactionAttributes parameter needs to contain an access control entry with the DTCâ€™s SID (S-1-5-80-2818357584-3387065753-4000393942-342927828-138088443) and the TRANSACTION_ENLIST right. For more information, see Distributed Transaction Coordinator and Access Control Components.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateTransactionManager(Vanara.PInvoke.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES,System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.CreateTrxnMgrOptions,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new transaction manager (TM) object and returns a handle with the specified access.
member.param: The transaction SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES (ACLs) for the TM object.

The log file stream name. If the stream does not exist in the log, it is created. To create a volatile TM, this parameter must be NULL and CreateOptions must specify TRANSACTION_MANAGER_VOLATILE, this transaction manager is considered volatile.

param.name: CreateOptions
param.para: Any optional attributes for the new TM.

item.term: Indicates that the TM is volatile, and does not perform recovery.

member.param: Reserved; specify zero.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the transaction manager.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: Immediately after calling this function, you must call RecoverTransactionManager.
If your transaction manager is volatile, all your resource managers must also be volatile.
You must call RecoverTransactionManager after creating a TM in order for the TM to function correctly.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetCurrentClockTransactionManager(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HTRXNMGR,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Obtains a virtual clock value from a transaction manager.
member.param: A handle to the transaction manager to obtain a virtual clock value for.
The latest virtual clock value for the transaction manager. See LARGE_INTEGER.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetEnlistmentId(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Obtains the identifier (ID) for the specified enlistment.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.
A pointer to a variables that receives the ID of the enlistment.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves an opaque structure of recovery data from KTM. Recovery information is stored in a log on behalf of a resource manager (RM) by calling the SetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation function. After a failure, the RM can use the GetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation function to retrieve the information.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.
The size of the Buffer parameter, in bytes.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the enlistment recovery information.
A pointer to a variable that receives the actual number of bytes returned in the Buffer parameter.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: This call cannot be used with volatile transaction managers.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetNotificationResourceManager(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HRESMGR,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Requests and receives a notification for a resource manager (RM). This function is used by the RM register to receive notifications when a transaction changes state.
member.param: A handle to the resource manager.
A pointer to a TRANSACTION_NOTIFICATION structure that receives the first available notification.
The size of the TransactionNotification buffer, in bytes.

The time, in milliseconds, for which the calling application is blocking while waiting for the notification to become available. If no notifications are available when the timeout expires, ERROR_TIMEOUT is returned.
A pointer to a variable that receives the actual size of the notification received by the TransactionNotification parameter.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: All resource managers must register to receive TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPREPARE, TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPARE, and TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT notifications, even if they subsequently call ReadOnlyEnlistment to mark an enlistment as read-only. Resource managers can support TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_SINGLE_PHASE_COMMIT, but they must also support the multi-phase pre-prepare, prepare, and commit notifications. For the list of all notifications that resource managers can receive, see TRANSACTION_NOTIFICATION.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetNotificationResourceManagerAsync(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HRESMGR,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Requests and receives asynchronous notification for a resource manager (RM). This function is used by the RM register to receive notifications when a transaction changes state.
member.param: A handle to the resource manager.
A pointer to a TRANSACTION_NOTIFICATION structure that receives the first available notification.
The size of the TransactionNotification buffer, in bytes.
A pointer to a variable that receives the actual size of the notification received by the TransactionNotification parameter.
A pointer to an OVERLAPPED structure that is required for asynchronous operation.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: All resource managers must register to receive TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPREPARE, TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_PREPARE, and TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_COMMIT notifications, even if they subsequently call ReadOnlyEnlistment to mark an enlistment as read-only. Resource managers can support TRANSACTION_NOTIFY_SINGLE_PHASE_COMMIT, but they must also support the multi-phase pre-prepare, prepare, and commit notifications. For the list of all notifications that resource managers can receive, see TRANSACTION_NOTIFICATION.

Resource managers (RM) may want to call this function more than once to provide multiple buffers for KTM to use when delivering notifications. The number of calls to this function depends on how much load your RM is carrying.
This function must be called after the SetResourceManagerCompletionPort function is called.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetTransactionId(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Obtains the identifier (ID) for the specified transaction.
member.param: A handle to the transaction.
A pointer to a variable that receives the ID of the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.GetTransactionInformation(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns the requested information about the specified transaction.
member.param: A handle to the transaction. The handle must have the TRANSACTION_QUERY_INFORMATION permission to retrieve the information.

A pointer to a buffer that receives the current outcome of the transaction. If the call to the GetTransactionInformation function is successful, this value will be one of the TRANSACTION_OUTCOME enumeration values.
Reserved.
Reserved.
A pointer to a variable that receives the timeout value, in milliseconds, for this transaction.
The size of the Description parameter, in bytes. The buffer length value cannot be longer than the value of MAX_TRANSACTION_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the user-defined description of the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.summary: Opens an existing enlistment object, and returns a handle to the enlistment.
member.param: The access requested for this enlistment. See Enlistment Access Masks for a list of valid values.
A handle to the resource manager.
The enlistment identifier.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the enlistment.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.OpenResourceManager(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ResourceManagerAccess,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HTRXNMGR,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Opens an existing resource manager (RM).
member.param: The access requested for the RM. See Resource Manager Access Masks for a list of valid values.
A handle to the transaction manager.
The identifier for this resource manager.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the resource manager.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: Immediately after calling this function, you must call RecoverResourceManager.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.OpenTransaction(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionAccess,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Opens an existing transaction.
member.param: The access to the transaction object. You must have read and write access to work with a transaction. See Transaction Access Masks for a list of valid values.
The GUID that identifies the transaction to be opened. This is commonly referred to as a unit of work for the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the transaction.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: Clients close the transaction handle by using the CloseHandle function. If the last transaction handle is closed without anyone calling the CommitTransaction function on the transaction, then the KTM implicitly rolls back the transaction.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.OpenTransactionManager(System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionMgrAccess,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Opens an existing transaction manager.
member.param: The name of the log stream. This stream must exist within a CLFS log file.
The access requested. See Transaction Manager Access Masks for a list of valid values.
Reserved; specify zero.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the transaction manager.
If the function fails, the return value is INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: Immediately after calling this function, you must call RecoverTransactionManager.
The LogFileName must be specified using the NT file format. For example: <drive>:<path>. Do not use the .BLF extension.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.OpenTransactionManagerById(System.Guid@,Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.TransactionMgrAccess,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Opens an existing transaction manager.

The access requested. See Transaction Manager Access Masks for a list of valid values.
Reserved; specify zero.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.PrepareComplete(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Indicates that the resource manager (RM) has completed all processing necessary to guarantee that a commit or abort operation will succeed for the specified transaction.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received for this prepare complete notification. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ReadOnlyEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Requests that the specified enlistment be converted to a read-only enlistment. A read-only enlistment cannot participate in the outcome of the transaction and is not durably recorded for recovery.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received for this enlistment. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: If a resource manager no longer needs to participate in a transaction without rolling back the transaction, it should call ReadOnlyEnlistment prior to closing the enlistment handle.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.ReadOnlyEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Requests that the specified enlistment be converted to a read-only enlistment. A read-only enlistment cannot participate in the outcome of the transaction and is not durably recorded for recovery.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received for this enlistment. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: If a resource manager no longer needs to participate in a transaction without rolling back the transaction, it should call ReadOnlyEnlistment prior to closing the enlistment handle.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RenameTransactionManager(System.String,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Renames a transaction manager (TM) object. This function can only be used on named TM handles. A new GUID for the TM is selected and can be retrieved using the GetTransactionManagerID function.
member.param: The name of the log stream. This stream must exist within a CLFS log file.
A value that specifies the current name of the TM.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RollbackComplete(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Indicates that the resource manager (RM) has successfully completed rolling back a transaction.
member.param: A handle the enlistment.
The latest virtual clock value received for this transaction. See LARGE_INTEGER.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.remarks: If the RM was not able to successfully roll back a transaction, the RM should request a full rollback by calling the RollbackTransaction function.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RollbackEnlistment(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Rolls back the specified transaction that is associated with an enlistment. This function cannot be called for read-only enlistments.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.
The latest virtual clock value received for this enlistment. See LARGE_INTEGER.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: This function is used by an RM to roll back a transaction in which it is enlisted. All work associated with the transaction is rolled back.
Rollbacks are allowed by enlistments at any time before it issues a prepare complete notification.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RollbackTransaction(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN)
member.summary: Requests that the specified transaction be rolled back. This function is synchronous.
member.param: A handle to the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function. The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RollbackTransactionAsync(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN)
member.summary: Requests that the specified transaction be rolled back. This function returns asynchronously.
member.param: A handle to the transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero, and GetLastError returns ERROR_IO_PENDING.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function. The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.RollforwardTransactionManager(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HTRXNMGR,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Recovers information only to the specified virtual clock value.
member.param: A handle to the transaction manager.
A pointer to the latest virtual clock value received for this transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.SetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HENLISTMENT,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets an opaque, user-defined structure of recovery data from KTM. Recovery information is stored in a log on behalf of a resource manager (RM) by calling SetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation. After a failure, the RM can use GetEnlistmentRecoveryInformation to retrieve the information.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.
The size of Buffer, in bytes.
The recovery information.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: This call cannot be used with volatile transaction managers.

The information that is provided by the user may not be durably stored in the log at the completion of this operation, but it will be durably stored by the end of the next commit operation for this enlistment.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.SetResourceManagerCompletionPort(Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.HRESMGR,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Associates the specified I/O completion port with the specified resource manager (RM). This port receives all notifications for the RM.
member.param: A handle to the resource manager.
A handle to the I/O completion port.
The user-defined identifier. Typically, it is used to associate the receive notification with a specific resource manager.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

remarks.para: This function must be used in conjunction with the GetNotificationResourceManagerAsync function, which provides the buffers that KTM uses to deliver notifications asynchronously. These functions provide a different way to receive notifications from KTM. You can use these two functions instead of the GetNotificationResourceManager function.
This function must be called before calling GetNotificationResourceManagerAsync.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.KtmW32.SetTransactionInformation(Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HTRXN,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String)

Reserved.
The timeout value, in milliseconds, for this transaction.
The user-defined description of this transaction.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is 0 (zero). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.summary: Indicates that the resource manager (RM) is refusing a single-phase request. When a transaction manager (TM) receives this call, it initiates a two-phase commit and sends a prepare request to all enlisted RMs.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received from the single-phase request notification. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.summary: Indicates that the resource manager (RM) is refusing a single-phase request. When a transaction manager (TM) receives this call, it initiates a two-phase commit and sends a prepare request to all enlisted RMs.
member.param: A handle to the enlistment.

param.name: TmVirtualClock
param.para: The latest virtual clock value received from the single-phase request notification. If you specify NULL, the virtual clock value is not changed. See LARGE_INTEGER.
To change the virtual clock value, this value must be greater than the current value returned in the COMMIT notification.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero (0). To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.
The following list identifies the possible error codes:

member.summary: The NOTIFICATION_MASK value for this transaction.

member.summary: The transaction identifier, sometimes called the unit of work.
